title: Release workflow Chrome verification fix
content:
Fixed the release.yml workflow Chrome package verification logic. The issue was incorrect handling of grep exit codes:

PROBLEM:
- grep -q returns exit code 0 when pattern IS found, 1 when NOT found
- The old code used: `grep -q "browser_specific_settings"; if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then echo SUCCESS`
- This logic was inverted: non-zero exit code (pattern not found) was treated as failure

SOLUTION:
- Changed to: `if grep -q "browser_specific_settings"; then echo WARNING; else echo SUCCESS; fi`
- Now correctly handles: exit code 0 (found) = warning, exit code 1 (not found) = success

VERIFICATION:
- Tested locally with both Firefox and Chrome manifests
- Triggered workflow via workflow_dispatch - Chrome verification step passed âœ“
- Firefox manifest correctly contains browser_specific_settings (found)
- Chrome manifest correctly excludes browser_specific_settings (not found)

FILE: .github/workflows/release.yml, lines 166-172
